thread.title: Calls for quotas to boost employment of people with a disability
thread.title_full: Calls for quotas to boost employment of people with a disability

title: Calls for quotas to boost employment of people with a disability
text: Australia has one of the lowest rates of employing people with a disability in the developed world.It hasn't improved for 20 years and advocates are now calling for radical change.Some want quotas introduced, to encourage businesses to hire more people with disability, or risk a fine.Featured:Job Napitapulu, summer intern at Commonwealth BankKaren Fisher, disability policy researcher University of New South WalesSamantha French, advocate People with Disability AustraliaSuzanne Colbert, chief executive Australian Network on Disability
